task.title: Change the Properties of Objects
task.shortdesc: You can change the layer, thickness, linetype, color, and linetype scale of one or more entities. Depending on the type of entity or entities you select, you can also change other properties, such as the start point and endpoint of lines, the center point and radius of circles, and the vertices of polylines.

context.p: You can modify all the properties of all entities simultaneously. For example, using the select command
and the Select by Properties option, select all blue entities and change their color to green.
In the Properties dialog box, changes that you make in the Layer, Color, Thickness, Lineweight, Linetype and Linetype Scale affect all selected entities.

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Properties from the mainmenu.
In the Properties palette, change the desired properties.

result.p: NOTE The Properties palette settings that display when no objects are selected determine the properties of new objects when you draw them.
